name: SciVCCM
short_description:
.sci scilab functions and routines whose the aim is to make possible the joyful simulate of many conductive membranes models. To implement models like Hodgkin Huxley, one must only add a ionic current  function, that is, at least a bivariated function of the membrane voltage and the gate probability to the respective ionic current and gate's speed(.sci file), and change the vclamp.sci file, the param field, to allocate the model constants. In order to deal with newly added currents, one must edit the files createCurrent.sci and evaluateCurrent.sci. To simulate: create a array of strings with all ionic species that will be added into the model("L" leaky current is obrigatory :-( ), create a column array with the initial conditions for membrane voltage and gates, do a list l = list(conductiveMembrane,ionnames,param); them do solve = ode(x0,0,t,l).
Have Fun!
summary: Scilab Voltage Clamped Conductive Membrane rotines package
